intro: Dicliptera novogaliciana, commonly known as the New Guinea daisy, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its vibrant blooms.
